website_summaries.verdict: Ideal if your belly is too sensitive for strapping systems or if you want to have hidden support under a layer of clothing.
pros: Made of seamless, breathable, moisture-wicking Nylon and Spandex blend
One of few pregnancy support belts that comes in plus sizes
Ideal for pregnancy as well as post-partum
cons: Some reports that support is inadequate and could be difficult to get on by yourself

customer_reviews.title: This band was perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: This band was perfect for me. I ordered the biggest size, it fits perfectly. im 2x and weigh 275-280. I am 5'6 and it fits perfectly. My reason for 4 stars is this band is NOT black. It is Navy Blue. That was disappointing as you can see it when I wear low shirts which defeats the purpose of the band. So if your wanting something black, this is not it. The packaging is says black, but the band is blue. Will post pics when I get home. Other than that it is great
customer_reviews.author: Nona ParkerTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this band! I got the biggest size they had in fear that it wouldn't fit my plus size self. I waiver between a size 24-28 for pants (booty problems!) And this fits super comfortably with plenty of space to spare! In addition it's so soft and comfortable and doesn't roll. I would buy this over and over again! Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: 2401MrsT

customer_reviews.title: Belly Cover Only, NOT Supportive
customer_reviews.text: While the 2X fit my 3-4X (sz 24/26) belly, it gave it no lift or support at all. The material is excessively stretchy. It's only useful as a belly cover, not a support panel. Though it is a decent quality weave, similar to maternity panels on pants. If you're looking for something that supports like a maternity belt or girdle, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a must have!
customer_reviews.text: If your anything like me this item sat in my cart for 5 days before I decided to buy it. I just kept coming back to the reviews hoping to find someone with the same body type as me with a good review. BUY IT NOW, you will be so happy you did!! I got the XXL (5’6 and 250lbs) it’s perfect. Not only does it shape my “B” belly into a D belly but I feel very secure wearing it. I absolutely love it and will definitely be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Olsen

customer_reviews.title: From B to D
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 18/20 pant. A lot of reviews said to order a size down, but I deciddd to just stay at the 18/20. I’m more pear-shaped, so I though that my natural hip/waist line would probably benefit from the actual size. I’m 26 weeks, and so far, this fits great. I got it at first to turn my “B” belly into a “D”, which it did, but the compression on my back helps a lot too. Right now, it’s comfortably snug. But I’m glad I got my true size for when I get bigger into my third trimester. Overall, happy for this investment.
customer_reviews.author: Herogrl

customer_reviews.title: Good, especially at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I've used this throughout my 4th pregnancy, and have tried several other types - this being my favorite. I'm a nurse and use this during my 12 hour shifts at the hospital. It's very comfortable standing or sitting (much more so than any other I've had) provides good support and helped with my back and hip pain. Only problem is it gets a bit stretched out by the end of the day and needs to be washed between each wear to tighten back up in order to provide enough support.
customer_reviews.author: P. Boyer

customer_reviews.title: nice job
customer_reviews.text: I am a size 26/28 normally and this worked great. Really helped my back. It does stretch out a lot after one wearing though but seemed to come back after washing.
customer_reviews.author: Severin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price!
customer_reviews.text: Although the product seems to run a little small, but that's hard to say as we're all different shapes and sizes, it's a very supportive comfortable fit! I'm normally a size 18 in pants, but have wider hips and the XXL fits great! This has really helped me continue to wear my clothes further along in my pregnancy and have comfort as my belly grows. I also plan to use this postpartum, as well, as I imagine it'll be very supportive; plus the benefit of wearing most of my clothes. I haven't had the product super long and hope to provide an update after a few months of wash/wear.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Love it. You need it.
customer_reviews.text: Loved how it smoothed out and supported my belly. I’m plus size 24/26 & was able to wear this my entire pregnancy with no issue. I literally wore this everyday as I worked up until hours before my labor. It just made my office clothes fit amazing with my bump while also keeping the pressure of my growing belly off my back. It’s the most comfortable support I tried while pregnant.
customer_reviews.author: ravenjanee1

customer_reviews.title: Ran way too small, thick, and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these with the rave reviews. I have been using a thin softer material one I bought at Target. I just thought I would maybe get more belly bands as this is now my second pregnancy. This material was much thicken and not so soft as the one I have. I felt it was more like a weight loss band then for helping with pregnancy support. To top, I bought a Large and I am normally a Medium and it was too small. I was ending my 2nd trimester when I tried it on to fit.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Really made a difference for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pregnancy and I have an umbilical hernia, and am picking up a 16 month old all day so my stomach could use some extra support. This has made a difference in the discomfort of my hernia and the pressure in my lower belly. Only thing is heading into summer here in Houston Tx its gonna be too hot to wear soon. But for a winter or spring pregnancy it would be great throughout. It does bunch a bit in the back after wear but is still supportive even then.
customer_reviews.author: ekstein

customer_reviews.title: Great Support. Love Belevation
customer_reviews.text: Love belevation. This gives good support. I am 5'7, Pre pregnancy weight 125 lbs. currently 23 weeks pregnant and weigh150 lbs. I ordered small, because I wanted it to fit snug. It fits great. Not too tight just right and its stretchy to accommodate my growing belly. Provides a good barrier between my clothes and skin when I apply creams on my belly. My waist Pre pregnancy was 25 inches. I'm about 40 inches in the waist now. I also have the short shapers by belevation as well and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Worth It !
customer_reviews.text: I’m a plus size mama (5’11” & 330lb). This helps a lot with holding my belly up and supporting my back. I got a size L and it was a little uncomfortable but once that back pain set in it was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Runs large
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to help with a B belly. I would size down, which I did but wish I had a little more but with twins on the way one size down will be ok. It works well with maintaining your posture, for me that made my back hurt at around the 29w mark and decided it was not worth it anymore. I will likely use again after babies come!
customer_reviews.author: B. Tadlock

customer_reviews.title: Supportive and rounds out the belly!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a size 14 prior to pregnancy but I’m 30 weeks pregnant now, 5’6 and about 225 lbs. I ordered a medium for now and after pregnancy but may need to order a large in a few weeks. It really does help with rounding out your belly when you had a belly prior to pregnancy. It’s also pretty comfortable. A bit tight at first and rolls down easily while sitting, bending, etc but nothing that you can’t handle. Just be aware of sizing when you order. The medium says 6-10 but it’s more like 10-14 I’d say. Although I planned for this because of the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: kmw wyo

customer_reviews.title: This band is amazing. I got a size smaller than I expected ...
customer_reviews.text: This band is amazing. I got a size smaller than I expected I would need because other reviews said it can stretch out and lose elasticity over time and that was a good decision. It fits perfectly and I love to wear it. It keeps me together and gives much needed support to my growing belly. I'm now 19 weeks and had it for about a month. The elastic is still very strong and I'm hoping I'll be able to use it for the rest of the pregnancy. If I outgrow this one, I'll make sure to order a larger one.
customer_reviews.author: The_Rick

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is very good, the fabric is thick and sturdy, the fit is good, no rolling or bunching. For some reason I expected a relief for back pain, but dont feel any. This might be more effective for more heavily pregnant bellies when it will fit tighter. I'm 20wks with my 4th baby and it does nothing for me. If you have a lot of lower back and hip pain be sure to try an SI belt instead, or in addition to this one. Its made well so I'm keeping it just in case it may help in those last months.
customer_reviews.author: E Tolentino

customer_reviews.title: I've bought 2
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased this little thing. I use mine because I'm plus size and have a colostomy bag. This gives me support around my appliance to reduce my hernia risk, as well as gives me a little a little extra privacy... smoothing it down, muffling sounds, and keeping things private if my shirt lifts up or the wind blows. I don't know if it's any good for pregnant ladies, but I really love mine and will probably end up getting a third at some point. I wish it came in a few more colors. They stretch out kind of quick, but will snap back into shape after a wash and dry.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I wore it pretty much through all 2nd and most of the 3rd trimester and it really supported my belly well. It's comfortable and fits true to size - I ordered S size (I'm 5'3" and 115 lbs before pregnancy and I wear XS or S size usually). I wore it mostly with leggings through all my pregnancy so I can't really say how well they support pants on you because pants weren't comfortable for me and fell off anyway. I recommend it especially when majority of your pregnancy falls on the autumn or winter months like mine because it gives you an extra warmth specially when your regular t-shirts, sweaters, hoodies etc. become to short:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not snug enough
customer_reviews.text: I have the version with the shorts as well as this one - sans shorts, I ordered the same size for each (XL) and this one sans shorts doesn't feel snug at all, the other is perfect. This one feels like I'm just wearing a shirt, that is huggin' my curves. Perhaps if I had a smaller size my opinion of this version would be better? It is comfy though, not scratchy or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Dmac

customer_reviews.title: I love these! I got them to hold up my ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I got them to hold up my non maternity shorts as I prefer mens shorts and of course you can't find those in maternity clothing. When I first opened them I thought they seemed very small and I would have to return them, but I tried one on and it fits perfectly. They don't ride up or down, and I am 7 months pregnant with a short torso and back side that is trying to keep up with the belly! I would highly recommend this belly band! As far as support goes, I feel like it does help a bit. As much as you can expect from a band like this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size down 1-2 sizes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after complaining to my OB of increasing pain and pressure late in my third trimester after she recommended some kind of support. I am 5’5, currently 256 lbs at 37 weeks pregnant, pre-pregnancy size of 18-20/ 2XL and ordered the large based on the recommendations of others. I’m glad I went with that size because it does feel supportive and I think anything bigger would not have been as supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Better off buying maternity pants.
customer_reviews.text: This BARLEY got me through the awkward phase of my first trimester. The belly band helped keep my pants up only half of the time. It often rode up my stomach when standing up. I definitely could not rely on it to always keep my pants up. I think you’re better off buying maternity pants. They are a lot more comfortable than this.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a fat-bottomed girl
customer_reviews.text: I am only 4 months along, so I don't have a big bump yet - what I do have is a big bump behind me (junk in the trunk.) Unfortunately, this band just rolled right up my booty and wouldn't stay down over my pants. Perhaps this gets better once the belly gets bigger?
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten J

customer_reviews.title: Good to hold pants up, bottom rolls when you sit
customer_reviews.text: Per the recommendation i ordered a large. It fits me ok. I was sz14 us before my pregnancy. Many people said it was huge. It rolls up at the bottom if I sit. It's not uncomfortable and I do use it to hold up pre pregnancy pants. But I was not expecting it to roll up on the bottom esp if I pull it low. I guess when I'm up and out and about it's not a problem. I'll just have to readjust it when I get out the car.
customer_reviews.author: liljsully

customer_reviews.title: Okay buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 32 in jeans (carry most of my weight in my belly even before pregnancy) and ordered a large. I should have ordered a medium so that this would've been more supportive. I ordered black but it looks more navy blue to me. I'm only 19 weeks so I'll keep it for when I'm further along in pregnancy when it should fit better.
customer_reviews.author: PateVPS

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, size down a lot
customer_reviews.text: Quality is very good, although the sizing is wonky, I’m a 14 or xl in everything, but do to the sizing guide on this I ordered a large...within a few hours it’s so loose it’s virtually useless...I’m 34 week right now and delivering early at 36 weeks so these no point in ordering another smaller size...but for me a medium probably would have done a better job supporting everything.
customer_reviews.author: MrsZat

customer_reviews.title: Wearing it to bed improves sleep!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 2 years ago when pregnant with my last baby and they still hold up now with a new baby! Around 30 weeks I started wearing to sleep in and it immediately improved my tossing and turning. It’s not so tight that feel any compression, just a nice extra support to have.
customer_reviews.author: Alita G

customer_reviews.title: Relieved mild back pain and smooths under tops
customer_reviews.text: This fit just as expected. It smooths nicely under clothes but mostly it actually helps with back pain. I have multiple issues w my lower back and this band compresses just enough to relieve mild pain. I have Gotten bigger now in my 7th month and will be purchasing the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Buy a size smaller than you think you'll need
customer_reviews.text: This is very comfortable and helps smooth the baby bump a good bit. I found it to be a lot larger than expected, and I could have gone at least a size smaller for more support, and it does go straight up past the bra and pants so it's got wide coverage if that's what you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Casper

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price point
customer_reviews.text: I love that it rounds out my stomach. Not all pregnant women have the perfect shaped tummy and this does the trick. If that’s what you’re looking for solely, it is a 5 star product. The reason I didn’t give it the full 5 is because I need it more for core support. While it does the job, it definitely could be more supportive. I have 2 other kids I chase around as well as working full time, so I’m constantly on the move. The elasticity wears out easy so I find myself having to throw it in the dryer just to fix it if I want to wear it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Ciara

customer_reviews.title: Size bigger than thought
customer_reviews.text: I am size 22 so I purchased the XXL for sizes 22-26. It doesn't really do anything to smooth anything out or offer any support. I think it may be too big. I am going to get the XL and hope that works better!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: super tight
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'6" and currently 7 month pregnant. Pre pregnancy I weighed 134lbs and would wear a size 6-8, currently I weigh 160lbs. I got a size medium when I was 3 month pregnant and that thing has been way too tight since I got it. I cannot comfortably wear it for more than a couple hours at a time and wearing it during/after a meal is impossible. If I got it again I would def go at least a size or two up, but honestly I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am 218 5’5” and wear an 18-20. I originally bought the xl and it felt good for a day or two then was to stretched to provide support so I ordered the large and it is absolutely perfect! I am 7 months pregnant and will be buying more before I give birth! Love love love!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Thomas

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret this.
customer_reviews.text: I have been dealing with sore belly for months now. Heard about belly bands but never tried them. Finally gave in. Best thing I ever did. I have been wearing it for 20 minutes now and I already feel better! My belly is no longer bouncing when I walk. It feels supported and lil baby seems to like the second layer of insulation. 6 months pregnant, I got the medium but will probably also get a large for 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Toby's Mama

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Fitting
customer_reviews.text: I sized down 2 sizes, and could have sized down a third. Product is long, so when you sit down it rolls up in the back, leaving a “bunched up” look under my shirt. Not very supportive - it was at first, but very quickly stretched out so now it makes no difference in the look of my belly.
customer_reviews.author: NOYB

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT! So much support!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this band to give me some extra support, between round ligament pain and a pain coming from my back from a previous accident, this band gives me extra strength. I'm a photographer and an accountant, between sitting 9 to 5 and shooting (photography) on the weekends, this band does it all for me!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and packaged neatly. I was skeptical on ordering since this pregnancy I am plus size. Pre-pregnancy about a 20 in bottoms, smaller waist but big hips, thighs and rear. I was unsure if the xl would fit. I tried it on and it fit great. Actually not as tight as I thought but somewhat supportive in holding stuff in place. 5'2 and it fits from the top my torso to half past my butt. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BlueberryDonut

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: Stretchy material but provided no support - just felt like I was wearing a weird cami. Also, if you're tall, this is not enough material for your belly and torso and certainly not long enough to pull over your hips! I tried this product on at around 16 weeks and I'm 5'8" and could't imagine it working throughout my entire pregnancy. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: H. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these, will be purchasing more, and wear them every day. The material is really stretching so it's not too constricting, but it still offers support and rounds out the belly. My only complaint is that it is incredibly long (and I have a pretty long torso as it is), so I usually have to fold it down at the top, which creates wrinkles under my shirts. But overall it's a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful fit! Enhances pregnancy belly.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is wonderful! Seeing as I'm only 13 weeks along, I ordered a size smaller based on other reviews. My regular jeans are too tight and my maternity jeans are too loose, this was the perfect go between. As comfortable as it is, I'll order a bigger size later in my pregnancy and use this one postpartum. Excellent product, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great fabric but the band does not stay in place well.
customer_reviews.text: I think the fabric on this product is awesome and I like the fact that the bottom of the band has more stretch to accomodate for a person's hips. However, the fabric rolls a lot and I'm constantly having to adjust it. While the bottom is designed for extra space, as soon as I sit down the band does not stretch to fit my hips and instead rolls up.
customer_reviews.author: Aesia

customer_reviews.title: Runs large
customer_reviews.text: These run big. I purchased an XL according to my size which was to big. I then purchased a large hoping that would fit, still too big. I'm currently wearing a medium which fits better but it doesn't support much. May order a small to try out. (I'm a pre-pregnancy size 18 and am 26 weeks along if this helps)
customer_reviews.author: S. Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Little too big
customer_reviews.text: Unless you've gained a lot of weight- definitely use your prepregnancy jean size. Was sceptical at first thinking it looked a little small when I opened the package, but turned out to be too big! I was a 8/10 prepregnancy so I assume I've gained a jean size. Ordered a large, thinking the medium would be too tight. I have returned the large, and gone with the medium.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: What a life change. So comfortable and high quality. I used to have so much trouble keeping my scrub pants up at work ever since my belly started getting big😅 this solves the the problem and provides so much support, I'm 39 weeks now, been wearing it since 28 weeks, feels so good on my tummy. Bought more as gifts. Highly recommended👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Hieu Phan

customer_reviews.title: If you are unsure of size, go down rather than up
customer_reviews.text: So overall the material is nice and this somewhat helps to smooth everything out. However, I was a size 18-20 prior to getting pregnant. I haven’t gained any weight. In fact, I’ve actually lost some (don’t worry Dr said it was ok that I was doing so). I wasn’t sure what size to buy so I went with the XL. I almost wish I would’ve gone with the large instead. It doesn’t really hold up much because it’s a little loose on me.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Smith

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay in place
customer_reviews.text: I got a medium and it is super loose and will not stay in place. I had a belly band when I was pregnant with my son years ago and loved it but this one is not even close to the one I used to have. I have to fold it down and readjust it all day long. Very uncomfortable and kinda a pain to deal with .
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna Carbajal

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not too sure if we are to buy a size bigger but I bought a large. I started to wear it I believe 4-5months into pregnancy when my belly started to grow & weigh down. I really like the support of this belly band, it perks my belly upwards I continue to wear it when I go out, or walks. I wouldn’t recommend sitting w it on for very long bcs it gets a lil tight around your waist. Other than that worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Vero

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I used this post partum when the need for the binders began to subside. It’s easy to wear under your clothes and is supportive enough as by belly gets smaller. I tried using it during pregnancy and it really was uncomfortable because I didn’t like being squeezed so tight, but I think this is best while your tummy is fairly small and going down. I would recommend sizing up if you are unsure.
customer_reviews.author: KJC

customer_reviews.title: A must-have maternity item
customer_reviews.text: I tried limiting the maternity items i bought, but I’m so glad i chose to purchase this. It has been a life saver! It stays in place and it’s comfortable. I love that it covers my unbuttoned pants like it’s supposed to and it also hides my belly button that loves to show through every shirt! It has worked from when my pants first started feeling snug (around 23 weeks) and is still working now that I’m at 34 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and subtle!
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, and got me through almost my entire pregnancy! I bought this originally at about 4 months pregnant when I couldn’t fasten my work pants anymore, and it worked perfectly to keep jeans, slacks, etc. subtly closed. I even wore it a couple times under a dress as shape wear to smooth out any lumps. I never had an issue with it rolling or bunching. I’m 5’10 and 150lbs prepregnancy weight, and the medium was just right. It probably stretched out a bit by the last couple months from regular wear and lots of washing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for early pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: 5'6", usually wear a size medium shirt (sometimes small) - ordered a small. It's ok for now (currently 20 weeks), but definitely won't be enough support for later on in pregnancy. Fits well, doesn't slide around, especially if I tuck the bottom of the band inside the top of my pants. Trying to keep it straight along the bottom on the outside of my pants (or trying to use it to hold up my pants) has been less successful. I can see this being too hot to wear in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping for more support.
customer_reviews.text: The support band overall fit well, however I did not feel like I was getting the amount of support I wanted. I wanted maximum support and with this band, I felt as though I had no support until I removed it and realized it was actually giving me support (I hope that makes sense). I am a larger woman so this may not be the case for smaller figured ladies.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tarin

customer_reviews.title: 2 pregnacies later
customer_reviews.text: This belly band is amazing. It helped me through 2 different pregnancies, one was a twin pregnancy (though to be honest, it didn't fit me at the end of my twin pregnancy but that wasn't a problem with the product lol). This really took the pressure off the bottom of my belly and by back. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie B.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is it stretches out pretty easy as I wear it multiple days, So I prob shoulda got a smaller size. But I just bought a second so I could wear one while I wash one so I can always have it on since when I don't ny back kills from being hugely pregnant lol
customer_reviews.author: shauna

customer_reviews.title: Great support!
customer_reviews.text: This little band has been such a huge help. No it’s not the same amount of support as those Velcro belts however it does offer enough support to alleviate everyday pressure. I’m 36 weeks and have been wearing it daily for the last week. The best part is that it’s affordable. We all hate to spend a on something you only wear while pregnant.
customer_reviews.author: Target Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Did its job.
customer_reviews.text: I like it it holds me together well and that's why I purchased it to hold me together in my baby shower dress. I'm plus size women so my stomach is large on top of the pregnancy. I think the flowers on the belly part are soo cute. The only 2 things I didnt like is the description says its seamless but that's not true, I can see the print through my dress. I also wish it was an opening below to make it easy to use the ladies room.
customer_reviews.author: Candii

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Update: I ordered a large and it made a world of difference. Go small y’all. I ordered an xLarge. I’m a size 16 pre pregnancy. I was hoping for support. It’s pretty loose and doesn’t offer much support and I’ve already gained 16 lbs. I’m carrying all my weight in my tummy. I’m pretty disappointed with this product. I may try a smaller one and see if it’s any better.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Good band!
customer_reviews.text: Good Band! however I should've bought a size down, I bought the XL, I'm 220 Pounds, 25 weeks pregnant, and 5’6” tall. The band feels a little loose, but it works good to cover my pants that aren't closing anymore and it makes my bump feel nice and round. I believe I could have order a size down, since it stretches very nice. The fabric feel very good as well. I would definitely recommend with the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra Masis R

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this would provide enough support, but it absolutely does! I was a size 16/18 pre-pregnancy and have an average sized bump now at 29 weeks and the Large fits perfectly. I wanted it a little tighter to add support, and I sleep in it often and wear it under my clothes because in addition to being supportive, it's a great smoother. My belly hurts a lot if I do a lot of walking so this is a must to wear either while walking or at night after a very active day. I plan to order an XL to get me through these last few weeks
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: B belly approved
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I’m plus size and had a B belly this not only gave me good support but made my belly look rounder. Once I got to about 8 months I had to switch to a belly brace because of the weight and pressure but I wore it up until then! It’s super stretchy and not itchy at all
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product and keeps pants up
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. I am pregnant with my 4th baby right now and cannot fit into any of my post pregnancy clothing. I didn’t want to buy a bunch of maternity pants so decided this would be the most cost effective option. This is very comfortable and keeps my pants up without a worry. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Run_Dealsrun

customer_reviews.title: One of the better plus size bands, but size down.
customer_reviews.text: Normally I buy a 1x or 2x, but I read the reviews and went with the large. It was the perfect size. The fabric is nicer than some of the other bands on Amazon and a little less likely to roll out of place, although it still does sometimes. It is thicker, softer, and comfier than other brands. I plan on purchasing more of these soon!
customer_reviews.author: Anom

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, buy at your pre-pregnancy size so it's not too big. Secondly, this thing is downright magical. I was able to control hip and back pain with yoga, but that 3rd trimester pelvic pain was killing me. I put this thing on and found myself standing up and sitting down again jusy because I actually could without discomfort. And I can roll over in bed and climb stairs with minimal pain! (I tried both, for science. 😁) I DEFINITELY recommend this product for pregnancy-related pelvic pain.
customer_reviews.author: Misael Cornejo

customer_reviews.title: Great band, size down
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is an awesome band. It is supportive and comfortable and doesn't roll at all. That being said, size down. AT LEAST one size. Before pregnancy, I wore a size 22 pant. I'm bigger in the belly normally and now I'm 21 weeks along. I bought the XL and honestly should have bought the Large. The XL is supportive, but it definitely has plenty of room to grow, and then some. Lots of stretch. I'm going to be ordering the Large asap.
customer_reviews.author: Malwynne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Fits true to the size chart. This has provided me with some relief of back pain and I plan on wearing this until my baby is born. It is comfortable and I often forget I have it on. It stays put and provides me with extra length for my shirts. This is my 4th baby and I don't know how I made it through the 3 others without this item.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Would reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5 months pregnant, 220lbs, 5'4" (longer torso) I bought this to smooth out my "B" belly. It works pretty great! Does not roll or slide down, does get a little stretched out after a couple wears but washing returns it back to the normal size. I'm going to buy another one! I could also see myself wearing this after the pregnancy
customer_reviews.author: Stacy McDonald

customer_reviews.title: So comfy. Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t live without my belly band! They run a little large so based off the review I ordered a large where normally I’m a XL-XXl depending on the store. I’m 5,5” 235 pounds 8 months pregnant. I bought this band months ago and have had plenty of room for my bump to grow in it. Not to mention it really smooths everything out and makes my belly look 10x cuter! Pictured I’m wearing my belly band under a skin tight shirt and feeling so confident!
customer_reviews.author: debbie garcia

customer_reviews.title: Love and absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love! Been having issues with round ligament pain and Attica pain. I am 20 weeks and it immediately helps with pain! Will be buying more!! I also bought the three piece brace and starting out plus size didn’t make it comfortable since I already have a stomach. Love love love!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Too constricting...
customer_reviews.text: I am 5’3” size 12 pre- pregnacy and ordered a large. The band is much too tight and long. It feels like wearing spanx, well actually spanx are much more breathable. This is not something you can wear during summer months. However I can see this working for back pain as I did feel some relief in the 4 hours I wore this but I felt like I was suffocating when I tried to sit. Perhaps if you size up and wear the band during winter the band could work. Unfortunately it just didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Salvador

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: It does help support your belly, but I wish I felt the support stronger UNDERNEATH my belly, that's where I want to feel the lift and snug-ness, not necessarily tight AROUND my belly like this is. I have issues with the hip area - it riding up and not finding a comfortable place for the bottom to sit, bunching up in my thigh crease, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Only two issues, I'm a bigger person, and my fat rolls make the top roll down, but its not that uncomfortable. Two, make sure you order a size down!! 5'3 and 230, i only had to get a Large. (I carry all my fat in my stomach) I got it when I was about 20 weeks and now I'm just over 30 and it still fits great
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great for when you start showing
customer_reviews.text: This was absolutely perfect when my pants started to not fit and I needed to leave the button or zipper open. It supported my belly and still cover my pants enough so I wasn't concerned about showing anything I shouldn't
customer_reviews.author: K. Tarr

customer_reviews.title: You need the longest torso ever for this to work...
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't even wear this for an hour without the bottom rolling up and causing much too much pressure on the bump. . . You need straight hips, a long torso, and have zero curves to your frame for this thing to even remotely work. Plus it gave zero actual belly support Threw it away after a few tries.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Necessary piece of maternity wear
customer_reviews.text: I've bought one of these for every pregnancy. I regularly recommend it to friends too. I have diastasis recti, so it's nice to have the extra support every day. It doesn't help with pelvic stuff necessarily but for everything else I won't go without it!
customer_reviews.author: C&L Freebourn

customer_reviews.title: Good - not GREAT for the price...
customer_reviews.text: It is not as "supportive" as I would have hoped - wish it was a little less relaxed in the middle which is where you really want that support - Its long in the torso and its tighter at the top and bottom, then the middle is sort of like control top panty hose material. I am a little past the midway point in my pregnancy, we'll see how it holds out as I get bigger. Size wise - it fits great. I'm a size 12-14 pre-pregnancy, ordered a large and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline R.

customer_reviews.title: just ok
customer_reviews.text: I'd rate this as just ok - it does the job of holding up your pants and smoothing out a little bit, but I was really looking for something that helped shape a little better. In the first few month of pregnancy, I just look lumpy and bloated - this doesn't really help with that.
customer_reviews.author: Lehigh

customer_reviews.title: Great for back support
customer_reviews.text: My wife wore this after 20 weeks for the whole pregnancy. She said it really helped her back and feel more secure. Even when she wore maternity pants, she would wear this over them to give her some added support. If it feels like it’s getting a bit loose, just wash it and it will tighten back up.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Smith

customer_reviews.title: Rolls up
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed with the product! Ever time I would walk or sit down the bottoms would roll up my back. I spent most of the day readjusting the material. Finally, I would just get so frustrated that I’d take it off. I typically wear 14/16 and got the largest size possible. It was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kalin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, definitely order 1 size up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 sizes because I just wasn't sure and had to send the size range I'd normally be in back as it was too tight. The quality is good and I am exchanging the smaller one for the larger one that fits so I have a couple of these. Definitely make sure you order a size up though.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Dunn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this band!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was having a lot of issues with pain from walking. I always thought I was too big to find a belly band to fit right. This one is perfect. I was 305 pre pregnancy and I'm up to around 320 now. I got the XXL thinking I'd definitely need that one but I could have possibly done with the XL. I'm glad for the extra room for growing though!! I've had very very minimal pain since wearing this band and I can wear it over my shorts so I don't have the button and zip them! I can't recommend this band enough! Definitely worth getting!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jacalynn Barksdale

customer_reviews.title: Hardly noticeable
customer_reviews.text: I needed a belt I could wear to work without it being bulky or make me look too funky. I purchased this because it was affordable and the reviews seemed to show it does help with the weight of a belly. It did! It may not give me the 100% pain relief that I desire but it helps a ton! and you can't see it under your clothes!
customer_reviews.author: kassi hill

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!! Runs very large
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I normally wear a 3x shirt in motherhood maternity or regular clothing. I bought a size large in this based on other reviews and it works great. I’m only 21 weeks pregnant so I expect it to work great for my pregnancy. I still have room to grow. Smooths out my belly and perks it up a big making it more round. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I started wearing this daily to help my umbilical hernia not protrude out like crazy while I’m pregnant! Does a good job. Plus it helps with back pains too by supporting the heavy baby belly.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Wanna look pregnant and not fat? Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: While you should definitely size down, this product is hands down amazing. It made me actually look pregnant. You can wash in the washing machine and dry on low. I washed mine on a weekly basis
customer_reviews.author: Ashley DeLashmutt

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: At first I hated this thing. But once I uaed it it helps so much. I had rny a year ago and my baby attatched to the scar tissue and with the loose skin the pain was bad. Because of this band not only does it help hold the skin it helps the pain and rounds me out. Only regret is I didn't buy two!
customer_reviews.author: Angel Wings Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the first 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This was a lifesaver up to about 6 months of my pregnancy. I was able to wear the extenders and put this over my jeans to smooth it out. I finally broke down and bought some maternity pants at 7 months because I was having issues with upper abdominal pain, but I would recommend this to anyone wanting to prolong having to buy maternity clothes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Helps with my round ligament pain. I think if I get much bigger I will need to size up for the remainder of my pregnancy. Only thing I do not like is it tends to slide down in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Samara

customer_reviews.title: Great comfy support for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as I was 22 weeks with my third child and already feeling ligament pain from chasing the other two around! THis is very supportive and I definitely notice the difference at the end of the day when I wear it or not. Thin enough to be comfortable under T-shirt’s yet supportive enough hat you can feel your belly drop when take it off. Bought medium and I was M/L size 8/10 pre-pregnancy
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Best. Purchase. Of first two trimesters.
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to get more of these because I thought i was being cheap, but I USE THESE EVERY DAY. What? Not only are they great for support, they make a nice layering effect if shirts fail, and I sometimes pull them up at the end of the night as a tube top while I get ready for bed. I’m definitely buying a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina E Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Rolls downward
customer_reviews.text: If you have any fat on your back, this band rolls down and won't stay up. Disappointed about that but otherwise ok. I wouldnt buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie S.

customer_reviews.title: I didn't expect it to be so comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Stays in place so I'm not adjusting it throughout the day, keeps my pants up even when I can't button them and just gives some extra support for my growing tummy. I wish I had known about this for my first two pregnancies!
customer_reviews.author: Tawnee

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have! I did not invest in one for my first pregnancy and I'm realizing now how much of a wardrobe saver it is! I use it all the time, it holds the bump up and in, it's supportive without being uncomfortable. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! I'm 25 weeks pregnant for reference, and I think I'll be using it the rest of my pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: BN

customer_reviews.title: A must buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly great support. I'm 8 months and have pelvic and hip pain. I was using another brace that was a bit uncomfortable then I received this and I'm in love. It's only day 2 but I hope this support lasts. It's easy to put it and looks great under clothes. I may get a smaller size for support once I give birth.
customer_reviews.author: M.C.R

customer_reviews.title: Great for delivery
customer_reviews.text: Great for postpartum and while in the hospital. I used my while in the hospital to keep the baby's monitors all connected without sliding around and the cables moving around
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Mcleod

customer_reviews.title: Get the size down if your looking for lift
customer_reviews.text: I may have gotten the wrong size idk. But I would say it didn’t do what I wanted...it doesn’t give any support... if your trying to smooth out your belly then yes...it does that but as far as any lift there is none....now if I had gotten a smaller size then maybe it would work...
customer_reviews.author: Emily parker

customer_reviews.title: good.
customer_reviews.text: This was extremely comfortable but it didn't "support" my belly. I was a big girl before I got pregnant and got even bigger/huge my last pregnancy. Its a great smoother and holder though!
customer_reviews.author: sweets

customer_reviews.title: Runs Large
customer_reviews.text: Listen to reviews, definitely runs large. I like how it helps to smooth, but it does not give much support I am almost 6 months Ling, so maybe it will fit more snuggly and help with pain when I get a little larger.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Not intended for wide hips
customer_reviews.text: Not intended for women with hips... I wore it for ten minutes and the only time the bottom didn't roll up on me was when I was standing still. I'm sure it would work great if I didn't have wide hips and a big butt. 🤷
customer_reviews.author: BarnesJ12

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical with the price, many comparable brands are much higher. But I was pleasantly surprised. I am 6 months pregnant with our 5th. This definitely isn't high support. But light weight more then a belly band. I am 116 currently and the small fits well. I will probably end up buying another support belt with more support towards the end, but for now it is working great. Also another plus it's discret you can't see it at all threw clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

product_meta.title: Maternity Band/Maternity Belly Band, Pregnancy Support Band
feature_bullets: US MADE PREGNANCY BELLY BAND FOR BACK PAIN
MOISTURE WICKING, FOUR WAY STRETCH, NYLON SPANDEX
PRE-PREGNANCY SIZES S 0-4, M 6-10, L 12-16, XL 18-20, XXL 22-56
PLUS SIZE MATERNITY BELLY BANDS ALSO AVAILABLE
